Package generation

Class BSPBranch

java.lang.Object
generation.BSPNode
generation.BSPBranch
public class BSPBranch extends BSPNode
BSPNodes are used to build a binary tree, where internal nodes keep track of lower and upper bounds of (x,y) coordinates. Leaf nodes carry a list of walls. Branch nodes are internal nodes of the tree. A BSP tree is a data structure to search for a set of walls to put on display in the FirstPersonView and Map. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    Constructor with values for all internal fields Upper and lower bound values are obtained from the given left and right branches, so those trees must be carry valid values.

      py - y coordinate

      pdy - y direction

    • store

      public int store​(Document doc, Element mazeXML, int number)
      Store the content of a branch node, in particular its left and right children The method recursively stores BSP nodes for left and right children. Note that the numbering schemes needs to match with the MazeFileReader class.
      Overrides:
      store in class BSPNode
      Parameters:
      doc - document to add data to
      mazeXML - element to add data to
      number - is an index number for this node in the XML format
      Returns:
      the highest used index number
